title: Test if you can get financial aid

sections.description: for us to be able to figure out if you have the right to financial aid, we need to know your income for the next 30 days. you don't need to enter mony you receive from Försäkringskassan,CSN,skatteverket or a-kassa. pleas chose the option that apply to you

inputs.title: Salary
inputs.helpText: Salary is mony you receive for work that you do

inputs.title: Part of rent
inputs.helpText: Part of rent means that you are getting help to pay your apartment or house rent rent, for example, if you share your home with someone else

inputs.title: Part of electricity
inputs.helpText: Part of electricity bill means that you are getting help to pay for your electricity bill, fill in the amount that you receive

inputs.title: Pension from another Country
inputs.helpText: Pension from another country means you are receiving mony from pension found outside of sweden, fill in the amount you receive

inputs.title: Borrowed or loaned mony
inputs.helpText: Borrowed or loaned mony is mony you borrow from someone else, or mony you have loaned out that is being repaid to you as cash, swish or transaction to you bank account, fill in the amount you receive

inputs.title: Other income
inputs.helpText: if you receive mony in any other way, please fill that in here. this can be for example inherited mony, mony you receive as a gift, or mony you receive from an insurance company

sections.description: For us to figure out if you have the right to financial aid, we need to know your expenses for the next 30 days.

inputs.title: Rent
inputs.helpText: Rent is the money you pay for where you live. This can be a house, an apartment or a room in a house.

inputs.title: Electricity
inputs.helpText: If you receive an invoice for electricity fill in the amount stated on the invoice. If you receive two invoices, one for energy network fees and one for the actual electricity usage, fill in the total sum for both.

inputs.title: Home Insurance
inputs.helpText: Home insurance is the fee you pay for insurance for your house or apartment.

inputs.title: Broadband
inputs.helpText: Broadband fee is the sum you pay for your internet access.

inputs.title: Childcare
inputs.helpText: Childcare is the money you pay for pre-school.

inputs.title: Dental Care
inputs.helpText: Dental care is the money you pay for visits to the dentist.

inputs.title: Medicine And Healthcare
inputs.helpText: Medicine and healthcare could for example be money you pay to visit a doctor or to pay for prescription drugs.

inputs.title: Home loan
inputs.helpText: Home loan is a loan for a house or an apartment you have purchased.

inputs.title: Travel Fees
inputs.helpText: Travel fees is what you spend on public transportation, for example tickets or monthly pass for Skånetrafiken.

inputs.title: Unions Fees And A-kassa
inputs.helpText: Union fee is the monthly cost to be a union member. If you pay for a-kassa, don’t forget to add in that cost.

inputs.title: Other Expenses
inputs.helpText: If you have any other expenses plaese fill that in here. This can be, for example, debts you have with rent, electricity or childcare, fees for garbage collection or fees for water and sewage.

title: اختبار ما إذا كان يمكنك الحصول على المساعدات المالية
